verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass after<WH310> these<WH428> things,<WH1697> that the butler<WH4945> of the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> and his baker<WH644> had offended<WH2398> their lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> was wroth<WH7107> against<WH5921> two<WH8147> of his officers,<WH5631> against<WH5921> the chief<WH8269> of the butlers,<WH4945> and against<WH5921> the chief<WH8269> of the bakers.<WH644>

And he put<WH5414> them in ward<WH4929> in the house<WH1004> of the captain<WH8269> of the guard,<WH2876> into<WH413> the prison,<WH1004> <WH5470> the place<WH4725> where<WH834> Joseph<WH3130> was bound.<WH631>
And the captain<WH8269> of the guard<WH2876> charged<WH6485> Joseph<WH3130> with them, and he served<WH8334> them: and they continued<WH1961> a season<WH3117> in ward.<WH4929>

And they dreamed<WH2492> a dream<WH2472> both<WH8147> of them, each man<WH376> his dream<WH2472> in one<WH259> night,<WH3915> each man<WH376> according to the interpretation<WH6623> of his dream,<WH2472> the butler<WH4945> and the baker<WH644> of the king<WH4428> of Egypt,<WH4714> which<WH834> were bound<WH631> in the prison.<WH1004>
And Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> in to them in the morning,<WH1242> and looked<WH7200> on them, and, behold,<WH2009> they were sad.<WH2196>

And he asked<WH7592> Pharaoh's<WH6547> officers<WH5631> that were with him in the ward<WH4929> of his lord's<WH113> house,<WH1004> saying,<WH559> Why<WH4069> look<WH6440> you so sadly<WH7451> to day?<WH3117>

And they said<WH559> to him, We have dreamed<WH2492> a dream,<WH2472> and there is no<WH369> interpreter<WH6622> of it. And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to them, Do not interpretations<WH6623> belong to God?<WH430> tell<WH5608> me them, I pray<WH4994> you.
And the chief<WH8269> butler<WH4945> told<WH5608> his dream<WH2472> to Joseph,<WH3130> and said<WH559> to him, In my dream,<WH2472> behold,<WH2009> a vine<WH1612> was before<WH6440> me;

And in the vine<WH1612> were three<WH7969> branches:<WH8299> and it was as though it budded,<WH6524> and her blossoms<WH5322> shot<WH5927> forth; and the clusters<WH811> thereof brought<WH1310> forth<WH1310> ripe<WH1310> grapes:<WH6025>

And Pharaoh's<WH6547> cup<WH3563> was in my hand:<WH3027> and I took<WH3947> the grapes,<WH6025> and pressed<WH7818> them into<WH413> Pharaoh's<WH6547> cup,<WH3563> and I gave<WH5414> the cup<WH3563> into<WH5921> Pharaoh's<WH6547> hand.<WH3709>
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to him, This<WH2088> is the interpretation<WH6623> of it: The three<WH7969> branches<WH8299> are three<WH7969> days:<WH3117>

Yet<WH5750> within three<WH7969> days<WH3117> shall Pharaoh<WH6547> lift<WH5375> up your head,<WH7218> and restore<WH7725> you to your place:<WH3653> and you shall deliver<WH5414> Pharaoh's<WH6547> cup<WH3563> into his hand,<WH3027> after the former<WH7223> manner<WH4941> when<WH834> you were<WH1961> his butler.<WH4945>

But think<WH2142> on me when<WH834> it shall be well<WH3190> with you, and show<WH6213> kindness,<WH2617> I pray<WH4994> you, to me, and make mention<WH2142> of me to Pharaoh,<WH6547> and bring<WH3318> me out of this<WH2088> house:<WH1004>

For indeed I was stolen<WH1589> away out of the land<WH776> of the Hebrews:<WH5680> and here<WH6311> also<WH1571> have I done<WH6213> nothing<WH3808> <WH3972> that they should put<WH7760> me into the dungeon.<WH953>

When the chief<WH8269> baker<WH644> saw<WH7200> that the interpretation<WH6623> was good,<WH2896> he said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> I also<WH637> was in my dream,<WH2472> and, behold,<WH2009> I had three<WH7969> white<WH2751> baskets<WH5536> on<WH5921> my head:<WH7218>

And in the uppermost<WH5945> basket<WH5536> there was of all<WH3605> manner of bakemeats<WH3978> for Pharaoh;<WH6547> and the birds<WH5775> did eat<WH398> them out of the basket<WH5536> on my head.<WH7218>
And Joseph<WH3130> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is the interpretation<WH6623> thereof: The three<WH7969> baskets<WH5536> are three<WH7969> days:<WH3117>

Yet<WH5750> within three<WH7969> days<WH3117> shall Pharaoh<WH6547> lift<WH5375> up your head<WH7218> from off<WH5921> you, and shall hang<WH8518> you on<WH5921> a tree;<WH6086> and the birds<WH5775> shall eat<WH398> your flesh<WH1320> from off<WH5921> you.

And it came<WH1961> to pass the third<WH7992> day,<WH3117> which was Pharaoh's<WH6547> birthday,<WH3117> <WH3205> that he made<WH6213> a feast<WH4960> to all<WH3605> his servants:<WH5650> and he lifted<WH5375> up the head<WH7218> of the chief<WH8269> butler<WH4945> and of the chief<WH8269> baker<WH644> among<WH8432> his servants.<WH5650>
And he restored<WH7725> the chief<WH8269> butler<WH4945> to his butlership<WH4945> again;<WH7725> and he gave<WH5414> the cup<WH3563> into<WH5921> Pharaoh's<WH6547> hand:<WH3709>
But he hanged<WH8518> the chief<WH8269> baker:<WH644> as Joseph<WH3130> had interpreted<WH6622> to them.
Yet did not the chief<WH8269> butler<WH4945> remember<WH2142> Joseph,<WH3130> but forgot<WH7911> him.
